alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Garden (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 7:43PM CDT until July 05 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected, mainly in low lying areas. * WHERE...Southern Garden and northern Deuel Counties in the panhandle of Nebraska. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Oshkosh, Lewellen, Bluewater Battlefield State Historical Park, Ash Hollow State Historical Park, Windlass Hill and Mount Vernon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain, low water crossings are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
